intro: Tarenna napieri, commonly known as the red-flowered tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
